definition: to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

pinyin: fang4 she4 xing4 luo4 xia4 hui1

sentences.english: Spots of rain had begun to fall.
sentences.chinese: 稀稀拉拉的雨点开始落下来。

sentences.english: They were moved to tears by his honesty.
sentences.chinese: 他们为他的诚实感动得落下了眼泪。

sentences.english: He slowly climbed over the fallen rocks.
sentences.chinese: 他慢慢地爬过那些落下来的岩石。

sentences.english: Of someone who rose and fell apart at the edge of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 在我们生活边缘涨起又落下的某个人的脸。

sentences.english: A. silver crescent moon set slowly below the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 一钩银月慢慢从地平线上落下去。

sentences.english: We could see the sun setting behind the white pagoda.
sentences.chinese: 我们能看到太阳在白塔后面落下。

sentences.english: The azure sky appeared to be so near and the clouds cast their shadows on the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 天很蓝，感觉很近，云在山上落下影子。

sentences.english: Of course, what goes up must come down.
sentences.chinese: 当然，不可否认的是，跳上去就必定得落下来。

sentences.english: All derricks lowered down and secured.
sentences.chinese: 所有的吊杆已经落下并绑牢。

sentences.english: The fenders had fallen off that old bus.
sentences.chinese: 保险杠已从那辆破旧的汽车上脱落下来。

sentences.english: Although autumn was well advanced, not a leaf had fallen from the trees.
sentences.chinese: 尽管已经深秋了，但树上连一片叶子也未落下。

sentences.english: People ran wildly as pieces of glass and bricks fell down.
sentences.chinese: 当玻璃碎片和砖块落下来时，人们荒乱地跑着。

sentences.english: I stood there until the moon had set.
sentences.chinese: 一直的我立到月牙儿落下去。

sentences.english: The box turned end for end as it fell, and everything spilled out.
sentences.chinese: 这箱子落下时翻了，所有的东西都掉了出来。

definition: lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
(of a meteor etc) to streak across (the sky)/(of a searchlight, lightning etc) to play across (the sky)
to flit across/to sweep past/to glance (strike at an angle)
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
to raise one's head/to perk up
